page.title: 12THE NEWSAGENT.
page.content: Before the shop became a Newsagents it was a Bakers, Butchers, Green grocers, Post Office and General Store. The extension on the shop was built in 1980. The best selling magazine is the Radio Times and the best selling newspaper is the Daily Express. They sell 420 newspapers each day. Six people help with the delivering of papers. One person does each area of village. They deliver the papers in the morning. Other things they sell are sweets, tobaco, stationery, toys, books, gardening things and fancy goods. 700 people go to the shop each day. The shop has a computer till. People who are new to the village often go there for information and are treated kindly. The owners of the newsagents are Mr. and Mrs Coley.
